DataElement.preferredName: Patient Anticonvulsant Agent And Negation Seizure Protocol Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria with regards to receiving protocol agent, anticonvulsant medication administration and the occurrence of seizures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Anticonvulsant Agent And Negation Seizure Protocol Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A drug or other substance used to prevent or stop seizures or convulsions._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Anticonvulsant Agent And Negation Seizure Protocol Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A drug or other substance used to prevent or stop seizures or convulsions.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.:A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Medicine to stop, prevent, or control seizures (convulsions).
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.
A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has a history of C
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of CNS metastases, have they received treatment and have either not had seizures or have been on stable doses of anti-seizure medicine and had no seizures for more than 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had seizure at presentation, has been started on Levetiracetam and has been stable for 48 hours prior to study registration, are they being treated at the  discretion of treating physician?
